Text:
This is just what I needed!  I've got a lot of computer documentation I want to study.   I wanted too get a few novels-- some Stephen King page-turners in particular,  to make it easy to get used to reading books from my computer. 

A lot of the books are in plain text format, which I love.  The download is fast (look at all those seeders!) and there are terrific freeware programs available which make reading plain text documents    especially convenient and comfortable.  I'm using Bookreader, a Linux program that shapes the text in a familiar two column format, like pages in a book, and makes it easy to bookmark.

Thanks again!

Ohoh, it's a golden mine! Fedjeviking the biggest thank ever is for you =) 
PS
Unfortunately, I have not found TOM Wolfe in this collection, so Fedj if you have his books, will you seed them?

ALL TXT documents.  No formatting...Each book might as well be 1 huge paragraph!  No page #s, no separation of paragraphs, no pictures.  I give this an F because it should state this in the Description!  2 Thumbs Down!
